content.description: Climb a wide, steep, right facing crack with a committing lie back move. You can finish up the 5.5 gully left of Macondo, or finish on the 5.9 bolted upper section of Macondo. The right 5.5 finish is loose and not recommended.

Starts in a corner 5 feet left of Utopia. A fixed pin is encountered 10-15 feet up. Continues up through a loose choss band before entering an alcove beneath a step overhang. Climbs around the overhang on the right merging with the finish of Utopia. Two bolt anchor/chain lower off on an exposed arête near the top of the cliff.

This route begins by climbing a broken low-angled crack system in between the start of the bolted routes Dystopia and Macondo. After 20 feet climbing, traverse right on a ledge with small tree then reach the base of another short crack system (crux). Continue up the gully left of Macondo (poor pro) or finish on Macondo.

Climb a run out section past 3 bolts through some unlikely features on a broken Orange and Red rock face. Continue to climb above the fourth bolt mantling on to a sloping ramp. Continue up and right to a stance where the 5th bolt can be reached. Chain anchor is another 15 feet past the last bolt just right of the arête.
Bouldery start and low crux leads up a pumpy dihedral on columnar rock.
content.protection: 5 bolts lead to a two bolt anchor on a ledge.
content.location: This route and its neighbor, Drill Rig, start under live oak trees on the left side of the cliff. OSD is the right of the two climbs and follows the right arete/dihedral

content.description: This was the first route bolted at the cliff and features excellent moderate climbing on rock which is amazingly granite-like for volcanic tuff. After climbing the initial slab face the route steepens through some classic features on a tower before topping out on a rocky promontory with a commanding view of Kimball Canyon Crag and the Black Tower below. Anchors can be accessed by carefully climbing down from the top of the cliff 15 feet above.

Fun side pulls and balance moves on the first pitch.

Floridita is the name of a small but famous watering hole in Havana, Cuba once favored by Ernest Hemingway.

Climb past three bolts in an ever-steepening shallow corner system. After clipping the forth bolt perform a series of tenuous stemming moves to reach a hidden jug below an overhang. As one reaches through the overhang to some big holds and gain a balancey stance on the lip before clipping the fifth bolt. You cannot reach the fifth bolt until you commit to the moves to surpass the overhang (exposed). Climb past another bolt on a face which is slightly less than vertical, clipping a 6th bolt before climbing to the shared anchor of Utopia
A bouldery start leads to 5.10 climbing before another strong sequence at the finish. You may want to stick clip the first bolt. This fun route has some choss.
content.protection: Five bolts to a shared two bolt anchor on a ledge.
content.location: Located to the far left edge of the cliff, Start up the left of two routes on columnar rock under oak trees.
